subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Thrift Store junk.

Hey Frank!
Dont ya just love thrift stores?!  Its amazing what ya can =
find in those places if you actually go in and look.  I not to big on =
the 469 but I thik thatsonly cuz of the clicking...it just annoys me and I =
end up focusing on that rather than voices.  Wish I had the abili=
ty to make a box...maybe if they approve me for school in the fall I'll tak=
e a cpl classes that would help...its not criminal justice but it could be =
an elective hmmm, I'll have to check into that.  Hope ur havin a good =
weekend so far.  Oh I heard from that guy finally, we didnt get the bo=
xes of radio parts! I was hopin...but I'll keep my eye out for more, ya nev=
er know what people are giving away on freecycle!
Rhonda

--- On Sat, 6/14/=
08, Frank Sumption <purplealiengirl@...> wrote:

From: Frank Sum=
ption <purplealiengirl@...>
Subject: [EVP-ITC] Thrift Store junk=
.
To: "Group" <evp-itc@yahoogroups.com>
Date: Saturday, June 14, 2008=
, 1:25 PM






Hi All;
 
 Busy-busy-busy! I found the RS arm ban=
d radio works the best, the 469 is a POS, mess with it too much and it quit=
s working. I have one with bad AM, and another with F'd-Up FM. I found=
 this Sony at the thrift store of $6.99, don't know if it's usable yet, but=
 it's better than $35 for the RS. Anoither Honda radio, this one is only a =
maybe at this point. 
 
 Techno question; I see people making ban=
ks of RS 12-469s, and I can only ask why!?  Some seem to hav=
e the technical expertise to build the sweep circuit, why not just make a s=
imple box that's proven to work? I wouldn't use that multi-radio set up, it=
'd be impossible to understand anything from it.  It would seem more c=
ost effective to start wit something that works. 
 
 The 12-470 c=
an use an external sweep voltage, but you have to locate the converter stag=
e that turns the digital pulses into a voltge the varactor can use. It take=
s the 8 volts (max) for AM, but FM is weird, it tunes form +4 to 8 volts. I=
 have newer car tuners like this as well. 
 
 Frank
 
 =
